title: Catherine Tyldesley reveals heavily bruised legs as she leaves It Takes Two filming
text:
She has been hard at work training for this Saturday's Strictly Come Dancing live show.

And Catherine Tyldesley showed the side-effects of her intensive training as she revealed heavy bruising on her legs after It Takes Two filming in London on Thursday.

The former Corrie actress, 36, had purple and green bruises visible on her legs as she climbed into a cab with dance partner Johannes Radebe, 32, after their appearance on the hit show.

Training: Catherine Tyldesley showed the side-effects of her intensive training as she revealed heavy bruising on her legs after It Takes Two filming in London on Thursday (with Johannes Radebe)

The star looked chic in a sun and moon patterned silk gown as she left the studios, with the skirt falling upwards as she climbed into a cab, revealing the effects of her gruelling training.

Her brunette locks were styled in soft waves while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up.

Catherine looked in good spirits as she linked arms with Johannes, who looked dapper in a gold striped jumper, leather blazer and matching trousers.

The pair will perform the Cha Cha to Steps' Scared Of The Dark on this weekend's Halloween special of the hit show.

Earlier in the day Catherine joked about the 'lurgy' which is jeopardising the show's live programme during her appearance on Thursday's Loose Women.

During her appearance, panellist Nadia Sawalha wore a mask over her face in order to protect herself against the sickness which is apparently rife on the Strictly set.

After previously saying she'd tried to dodge the illness, Catherine said: 'We're alright, we've overcome it babes we've had it we've got loads of vitamin C we're fine.

A source told The Daily Star on Thursday that several stars have been hit by the bug which has spread quickly behind the scenes, with Catherine admitting she's determined she's been trying to dodge 'the lurgy.'

Style: Catherine looked in good spirits as she left the TV show while revealing the bruises on her leg

Leggy display: Oti Mabuse looked sensational in a tartan mini skirt at the studios

She said: 'The lurgy has been doing the rounds at Strictly for weeks. It's been trying to get me but it won't win!'

It comes after head judge Shirley Ballas took to Instagram last week to reveal that she had put herself on a vitamin trip, after a 'tough' week left her feeling 'under the weather.'

A source said: 'When someone gets sick it quickly spreads through the cast. Lots of people have been under the weather but the show must go on.'

The publication also said the producers have stocked up on medicine for sick cast members and have encouraged everyone to sanitise their hands regularly.

A representative for Strictly Come Dancing declined to comment when contacted by MailOnline.
